page.title: 12Dairy Farming at Painswick
page.content: Jenkins farm is mostly a dairy farm.Mr Slinger has 70 cows consisting of 12 in calf heifers,30 yearling calves,20 calves at 10 months,and 8 calves at 2 months.Mr Slinger keeps Friesian cows,Cross Hereford cows,and steers for beef.Half the equipment on the farm is modern.The hardest time of the year to farm for Mr Slinger is May to September.The crops that are grown on the farm are corn,grass for fodder, rape and turnip. Mr Slinger works 120 hours a week in the summer and 84 hours a week in the winter.The farm consists of 200 acres of land,mostly grass and 12 acres of corn.There is a lot of woodland which can't be farmed.Mr Slinger says he enjoys farming in this area,although the hilly ground makes it difficult.
